author: Mario Sergio Lima, Bruce Douglas, Matthew Malinowski
description: Brazil’s President Michel Temer has defied calls for him to step down, saying a Supreme Court probe will debunk allegations he participated in a cover-up.
title: Brazil Sinks Deeper Into Political Crisis

author: Fred Imbert, Evelyn Cheng
description: The iShares MSCI Brazil Capped ETF (EWZ) crashed more than 17 percent on the back of an emerging political scandal.
title: Brazil stocks plunge 10% on emerging political scandal

author: Euan McKirdy and Flora Charner, CNN
description: Brazil's leadership lurched into another bribery scandal Wednesday, as one of the country's biggest newspapers accused President Michel Temer of paying a former senate colleague hush money.
title: Brazil's president accused of bribery

author: Patti Domm
description: U.S. companies with high exposure to Brazil could be vulnerable after a new scandal emerged in the country this week.
title: These U.S. stocks have the most at risk from the emerging Brazil crisis

author: Anthony Boadle and Ricardo Brito
description: Brazil's President Michel Temer on Thursday defiantly said he would not resign from office despite a Supreme Court decision authorizing an investigation into allegations he condoned bribery of a potential witness in a major corruption probe.
title: Brazil's Temer refuses to resign in face of investigation

author: Eric Lam, Peter Millard
description: Brazil’s real, stocks and bonds sank as a fresh political crisis ensnared President Michel Temer and threatened to derail a reform agenda that had helped restore confidence in the embattled South American nation.
title: Brazil Markets Sink, Triggering Circuit Breaker on Fresh Crisis

author: Paulo Trevisani
description: Brazil’s President Michel Temer is under investigation in connection with a sprawling corruption scandal, the country’s Supreme Court said, as opponents called for his impeachment and financial markets plunged.
title: Brazil Graft Probe Targets President, Markets Drop Amid Impeachment Talk

author: Rachel Gamarski, Bruce Douglas
description: Brazil has plunged back into political crisis, reminiscent of the chaos surrounding last year’s impeachment process, following reports that President Michel Temer was involved in an alleged cover-up scheme with the jailed former speaker of the lower house of Congress.
title: Brazil Plunges Back Into Crisis as President Accused

author: The Economist
description: Newspaper revelations put Brazil’s reforms at risk
title: Leaked recordings are trouble for Michel Temer

author: Marta Nogueira and Simon Webb
description: Brazil's state-controlled oil company Petrobras (PETR4.SA) will pay its first shareholder dividend in three years if the company turns a profit in 2017, Chief Executive Officer Pedro Parente said on Wednesday.
title: Exclusive: Petrobras turnaround could yield first dividend in years in 2017
